title: Compact, scrollable HUD tabs for small screens

requirements.summary: Make HUD tabs horizontally scrollable and reduce per-tab width so all tabs remain reachable on small screens.
acceptanceCriteria: On narrow/mobile-sized viewports, the tab bar does not prevent access to the Settings tab (it is reachable via horizontal scroll/drag).
The tab bar does not overflow outside the viewport; extra tabs remain accessible via horizontal scrolling.
No regression on desktop widths: tabs remain visible/usable without requiring scrolling when space permits.

file_operations.description: Adjust the HudTabsBar markup/classes to support an overflow-x scrolling tab list (including touch/pointer horizontal drag scrolling) and to ensure tab triggers size to content (reduced padding/min-width) rather than forcing equal-width tabs.

Add/adjust CSS for HudTabsBar (e.g., `hud-tabs-list-enhanced` / `hud-tab-trigger-enhanced` and related sub-elements) to enable horizontal overflow scrolling within the viewport, prevent layout overflow, hide/trim scrollbars appropriately, and tighten spacing so more tabs fit on small screens while remaining usable on desktop.

requirements.summary: Add a compact visual mode for HudTabsBar at small widths that shows only the primary tab label and removes micro-text.
acceptanceCriteria: At small widths, tab triggers display only the primary label (e.g., BASICS, MEDICAL, â€¦, SETTINGS) and do not render the micro indicator line.
Tab labels remain legible and do not overlap adjacent tabs; truncation/ellipsis behavior is acceptable if needed.
Switching tabs still works identically (click/tap) and active styling remains clearly indicated.

file_operations.description: Introduce a compact rendering behavior for HudTabsBar (e.g., by adding a compact-mode class or structure that allows hiding the micro line and optionally reducing non-label elements at small widths) while keeping tab values and switching logic unchanged.

Implement responsive compact styling for HudTabsBar at small widths (via media queries and/or a compact-mode class): hide `.tab-trigger-micro` (micro indicator line), ensure `.tab-trigger-label` remains readable with nowrap + ellipsis as needed, and keep active-state styling clearly visible.
